meanings.definition: (verb) to curse or swear using the name of God
meanings.sent1: When he stubbed his toe, he goddammed loudly in pain.
meanings.sent2: She goddammed at the top of her lungs when she realized she lost her keys.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to goddam after hearing it so often in the house.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to goddam angrily as lightning lit up the sky.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor would goddam whenever a wave crashed against the ship.

meanings.definition: (adjective) used as an intensifier to express anger or frustration
meanings.sent1: He was in a goddam mood after his car broke down on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The goddam traffic made her late for the important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave her owner a goddam look when he forgot to feed her.
meanings.sent4: The goddam heat of the desert made the journey unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The goddam noise from the construction site kept him up all night.
